headline: Here's the likelihood of getting a $1,200 stimulus check in the next two weeks
summary: The White House and Democrats say they are now closer to making a deal on another round of fiscal stimulus before the Nov. 3 election. Here's where the negotiations stand.

headline: PayPal gets into crypto with new features for trading and shopping
summary: PayPal is the latest large financial services provider to show an interest in the cryptocurrency space.

Investors looking for the best of both worlds are often forced to choose between cost efficiency and a full-service advisory experience. But technology and innovation are creating new frameworks and opportunities for advisors.

headline: Danone hopes it’s blazing a trail by adopting a new earnings metric to expose the cost of carbon emissions
summary: Danone hopes it won't be long before other firms start to report the cost of their carbon emissions alongside traditional profit metrics.

headline: Snap earnings signal an online advertising ‘bonanza,' Pinterest and Twitter shares rise
summary: Tech companies in the advertising space rose Wednesday after Snap's third-quarter results signaled strength in the ad market after a difficult year because of the coronavirus pandemic.

headline: Apple's new iPad Air is a big upgrade and the one most people should get
summary: If you want an iPad that you can use for work, with cameras that are better for video chats and an optional keyboard accessory with a mouse, the new iPad Air is the one to get.
With the 2020 election less than two weeks away, options strategist Garrett DeSimone analyzes what volatility patterns and U.S. Treasurys yields are saying about the possible outcomes.
headline: 'Unusual' volatility pattern makes for a risky but profitable 2020 election trade, strategist says
This small American car company now has the world’s fastest car (316 mph) — take a look
summary: The SSC Tuatara, made in Richland, Washington by a company with 24 employees, beat out the likes of France's Bugatti and Sweden's Koenigsegg with an average speed of over 316 mph to become the world's fastest car.

headline: Stimulus package is unlikely to get through Congress before the election, Goldman Sachs says
summary: Chief negotiators for their respective parties remain at an impasse over key matters such as aid to states and business liability protections.
In the wake of the Justice Department's antitrust lawsuit against Google, traders Mark Tepper and Matt Maley discuss the impact on Alphabet stock.
headline: Google under fire: What the DOJ's lawsuit means for Alphabet

summary: Amazon has ramped up curbside pickup at Whole Foods stores during the pandemic, amid a broader shift to online grocery shopping.
headline: Amazon launches one-hour grocery pickup at all U.S. Whole Foods stores
TikTok says it plans to do more to tackle hateful content after reports it has a 'Nazi problem'
summary: TikTok has pledged to do more to tackle hateful content and behavior on its platform following reports that it has a Nazi problem and a White supremacy problem.
For the first time since 2004, the average out-of-network ATM fee fell in 2020. But other types of banking fees are still rising.
headline: ATM fees didn't increase in 2020 for the first time in 15 years—here's why
Amazon employees can work remotely through June 2021
summary: Amazon follows in the footsteps of several tech companies that have extended their work from home policies until at least early 2021.

headline: Black Entrepreneurs Day shows 'people want to make a difference,' FUBU CEO Daymond John says
summary: FUBU CEO Daymond John illustrated what the public can expect to see when he hosts Black Entrepreneurs Day on Oct. 24.

headline: Jim Cramer: Three solar stocks to play on a Biden presidential election victory

summary: Netflix's Ted Sarandos is feeling confident that the company's slate of films and television shows planned for release in 2021 will find a place on the streaming service next year.
headline: Most of Netflix's 2021 slate of TV and film won't be hindered by coronavirus
A Democratic wave could make things much easier for the marijuana industry, Jim Cramer says
summary: "Just remember, stick to the picks and shovels plays or the vertically integrated operators that are actually profitable," the "Mad Money" host advised investors.
